headline: Oven Baked Omelet
description: Make an omelet in the oven with this perfectly puffy recipe made with sour cream and milk. This is a great dish to make when cooking for several people!
name: Oven Baked Omelet

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 8x8-inch baking dish with butter.
Beat eggs, sour cream, milk, and salt in a bowl until blended. Stir in green onions. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish.
Bake in the preheated oven until set, 25 to 30 minutes. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over eggs and continue baking until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes more.

review.reviewBody: Made this for my family & picky husband & they absolutely loved it. My husband hid extra to make sure he would get another piece.

This was delicious! I did add 1/2 c. chopped ham, 1/2 green pepper diced, and a small tomato diced. At half hour of cooking in a casserole dish, it was still soft in the middle, so I added the cheese, covered it with the casserole lid and cooked another 10 to 15 minutes. It was perfect. Will add to my guest breakfast arsenal.
I loved this recipe!! I did add spicy sausage to it and this increased the amount of time it had to cook. This is my go to recipe for Sunday brunch.

Since I can't do dairy, I subbed in plain almond yogurt & milk, and skipped the cheese. I was short on time so I used onion and garlic powders instead of veg, and it turned out great, very fluffy and moist.

I have made this recipe several times now and it is a brilliant idea. I have experimented with all kinds of veges and meat additions. I have also segmented into meal size portions and frozen them for breakfast in a hurry or an easy warm up at work. Turned out very well.

This was pretty good, we will have again. I only used 1/2 teaspoon salt, instead of the green onion, I used 2 tablespoons of Tastefully Simple's Onion Onion Seasoning, added a bag of frozen mini broccoli florets that I made in the microwave prior to mixing in. Put it in the oven for 30 minutes, then spread 1/2 cup of cheddar cheese on it and then put it back in the oven for 5 minutes.

I made it, but added jalapeños, red pepper flakes, green onion, salsa, cumin, and sautéed garlic. It was really good! I also increased the sour cream a bit. Next time, I’ll add some fresh cilantro, red onion, more salt, and Parmesan cheese.
Loved it, great for adding some leftover veggies and such
I followed this recipe to a T and half of it came out runny!! Absolutely disgusting!!

Excellent! I adjusted the amount of ingredients for two. Also I made a few substitutes due to "called for" items were unavailable in my kitchen at the time. I used Ranch buttermilk dressing instead of "sour cream" and Buttermilk instead of "milk". I also added 2 slices of chopped precooked bacon, 1 small diced tomato and diced 1/2 jalapeno seeds and all. I baked at 350 degrees in my 8" cast iron skillet. This is absolutely delicious! Easy clean up also.

Added cooked sausage, garlic, onions, Italian spices, diced tomatoes, and Parmesan cheese to create an Italian flair. We liked the addition of sour cream in this recipe compared to our usual recipe for baked omelet. This tasted even better the next day. I plan to make it again and vary the ingredients.
This combination is heaven
Very good, fluffy eggs and a nice flavor.
My omelette was not còoked in the 30 minutes
Delicious..my family love it...
It turned out great and this is the first time using sour cream in eggs so I was a little worried but it worked. I also added some veggies and cubed ham for extra flavor. This is a keeper!
It is very quick & easy to make... I only added herbs & seasonings to mine. I then topped it off with shredded cheddar cheese. It was a hit for a weekend brunch!
We love this recipe! Thank you for sharing!
I've had notoriously bad luck with omelets in the past but this turned out perfectly, great recipe! I added a few more spices and herbs but not a lot. Delicious!
Quick & easy. Added peppers, bacon & cheese, S/P. Great light dinner.
Yummy and easy! Added thyme, basil, garlic, spinach, tomato and fresh cilantro.

Note for if you add mushrooms and substitute more milk for the sour cream - you need to add 10-15 minutes (I did 13) to the cooking time to let the eggs finish setting. It's probably mostly because of the milk rather than the sour cream, but the mushrooms might play a bit of a role as well.
As you can guess, I added mushrooms to the recipe and substituted 1/2 cup more milk for the 1/2 cup of sour cream.

Edit (March 15/20): No, it's my oven. I made it again on the 13th, this time with the sour cream (and with sautéed onions and spinach rather than green onions), and again I had to cook it for longer. But the sour cream did make a definite difference to the fluffiness, and it was a good way to finish off the container!

Made this for dinner alone as Hubs was out of town. Made it exactly as written but scaled down to 2 servings. - Wanted a quick breakfast next morning. Ohmy - so good. Making again now for brunch . Cant wait to share with my dear - I know he will love it. Eggs are a big fave. This will be added to our recipe box. So good. So easy. Very budget friendly AND you can clean the fridge to make it. Thanks for such a fantastic recipe.

I have made this recipe several times. It is very easy and delicious. Good for a brunch and honestly with flour tortillas or toast it simple yet delicious! I have made it with actual finely chopped onions and it tastes very good!

This was good. It would be a good fit for a few people for breakfast. I didn't give it five stars because this is my first review and I didn't think it was like a top chef dish. I am adding it to my personal cookbook.
I made this with no substitutions and it was delicious. It smelled so good while cooking! The only thing I will do differently when I make it again is put a little bit more ham in it.
Added chopped cooked bacon and chopped mushrooms.
Great recipe! Easy and delicious. Beautifully fluffy eggs! Can't wait to try new variations, different cheeses, maybe some meat.
This is a fantastic , quick and easy meatless meal! My whole family loved it!!
so presentable and so easy.. i believe the sour cream makes it so fluffy.. enjoy for breakfast or even a Sunday easy dinner.

I now only make my omelets in the oven! This recipe is great and the omelet turns out moist and fully. I make sauage and bacon a head of time so that I can crush it in the mixture. I love adding the sour cream and diced green chiles....so good!

I made it exactly as written but had to add about 10 minutes as middle wasn't set. It is easy and fluffy and everything you would want in an omelet. Next time I will add some roasted red peppers, Canadian bacon and Gruyere to the eggs before baking. I used lower fat sour cream and evaporated skim milk and it was rich and wonderful.
I really enjoyed this. The texture was lovely and it was very tasty. I added some chopped back bacon and it really made a super breakfast.

I followed the recipe exactly except for adding bacon bits. It was moist, fluffy and easy to put together. It did need a bit more seasoning--perhaps garlic or onions in the egg mixture. Mushrooms would also be good. I also liked one reviewer's idea of adding some cheese into the egg mixture. I had to bake it about 45 minutes before it was set. I reheated some in the microwave for dinner the next day and it reheated well.

I made it as written the first time for overnight guests. Even the picky kids liked it. It was a hit! Since then, I've been making it for my husband and me, refrigerating the leftovers. I now add peppers, mushrooms, onions, crumbled sausage, ham, chives, tomatoes, spinach, a bit of garlic powder and salt, and ground pepper. It's great for my husband to take to work the next day. I've never been able to make omelets, and don't like the recipes I've found using potatoes or bread. This one is perfect! Thank you so much for the basic recipe!!
Awesome creamy puffy dish . Very filling and tasty.

Very delicious. I would recommend baking it the full 30 minutes. Also throwing a little meat in there like some sausage or bacon. Also a little pepper would make it good. I doubled the cheese also. Overall I think it was extremely delicious and I would highly recommend!!!!!!
I would leave everything to same and will not change anything

Added chopped black forest ham, touch of brown sugar, sautéed garlic, onion and mushroom and used combo of swiss and parmesan cheeses instead of cheddar. Will definitely make it again trying different 'filling' ingredients.

YUM - EEE! I made it for a Light Lunch, when the Wife was @ TiChe. She luvd it... ME 2! ... SURPRISINGLY LIGHT - PLAIN - DELICIOUS! ...AND We are ANXIOUS to try Variations on the THEME ... Thinking of Limitless Combos: Bacon, Sweet Peppers, Mushrooms, Onions, & LOTS More... We Like The BAKE, instead of Frying...
This was excellent!!!
25 min was not near enough time for baking. I added another 10 min. Next time I'll add crumbled sausage or bacon to the mixture before baking.
I did some add ins and used a casserole dish which required some additional baking time. But easy recipe. A must keep!

I'm going to make a habit of having this on Sunday mornings. As a matter of fact, I'm eating it while I type this review. 

Turned out really well. It reminds me of something you'd get at a bed & breakfast.

Used dried chives as that's what I had on hand.

Very quick and easy. I added finely diced green bell peppers for my wife ali by with chopped ham. instead of sour cream I used spinach and artichoke dip. cooked in stoneware dish for about 40 minutes on 350.

Absolutely delicious. A bit salty but the second time I made it I lowereewd the salt considerably! My boys and husband love breakfast sausage so I added a little bit to the omelet. Super super delicious!
Yummy probably cooked 3or 4 minutes to long but very good
I ran out of sour cream so replaced with whipped cream cheese- really tasty! I cut up and brought to work for breakfast. Will definitely make again!
Delicious!
I in joyed it quite good and will make it again
We love this breakfast. It has become a regular.
I didn't make any changes AND IT WAS MAGNIFICENT. I will be making it again

Great inspiration!
Added a few additional items to suit my tastebuds, i.e. 5 different grated cheeses, feta cheese and yogurt. Reduced quantities to ? for a light meal.
I added green pepper and fresh mushrooms. I didn't have green onions so I put some red onion in it. It was easy and tasty.
Great recipe. Had to adjust recipe for fewer servings and came out great. My husband loved it. He likes potatoes so I cut and boiled a potato and added it in the dish.
Next time I will add bacon bits, mushrooms and zucchini.
It was very good. I will fix it again in the near future with green pepper and mushrooms.
I added ground sausage to the recipe. It turned out awesome!!!
Read all the favorable reviews, and was very excited to try it. Disappointed to say the least. I found it to be very bland and dry. Won’t be making this one again.

I made it my own by adding Red Bell Peppers and One Jalapeño. It came out a tad runny but I cooked it a few minutes longer and it did the trick! Good easy recipe for Sausage Egg and Cheese casserole Lovers!

Fast!
Easy!
Delicious!
Yummy!
I used sweet onions and added ham
I added onion powder because I didn't have any green onions. It was very good my girls ate two servings each. Recommend trying its easy and yummy.

Nixieno
what is your problem
easy to make, good for a change

Added fully cooked sausages diced up with Chorizo.
Yummy
Next time I will add peppers and onion.
I added the butter to it and sprayed the pan instead also added some diced ham and salsa then baked it was delicious.
Yes I will make it.

This was very tasty and fluffy. When I looked at the recipe, I decided to add a tablespoon of Fines Herbes since it seemed it might need more flavor and it is, after all, an omelette, and an omelette aux fines herbes is classic French.

This was so quick and easy to put together. Unfortunately, I had no green onions so I chopped up some onion. Also, I halved this recipe and I added some ham that I had that was leftover. Even halving it this had to bake for 30 minutes (at 325) before the center set up. I'm not the best at scrambling eggs but I've been adding a good Tbsp of sour cream to two eggs which makes them nice and fluffy. So be sure to add the sour cream. Will do this again! Thanks for posting.
No changes. Yes, I'll certainly make it again.

I'm giving this recipe 5 stars because that is how much I liked it. The dish was fluffy and light. I was at a loss because NixieKnox gave it a one star because she said, "So basically a frittata. Let's just call a spade a spade here." Does that mean you didn't like the taste of the dish? Or maybe for you it was just a common dish. You see, I've never had a frittata before, and to make a comment like that is just unkind and ignorant. I made the dish as directed and it was delicious.
Easy, delicious and nutritious! I used plain Greek yogurt instead of sour cream.

I needed to cook this longer as the middle was not cooked through. Next time I might use a slightly bigger dish to cook it in. The versatility of this recipe is great. And the eggs came out so light and fluffy.
Very easy but a bit boring. We made this for dinner but it's better for a breakfast casserole.
This really does come out light & fluffy. I didn't change the recipe only cut it down and put in ramekins for 4 people.
Great recipe. It is so easy to make and tasted delicious. I'll be making again soon

An excellent dish! Added some chopped ham, paprika, garlic powder and extra shredded cheese to the egg mixture before placing in oven. Baked for about 45 - 50 minutes to firm it up though. A wonderful dish!
I added finely chopped green pepper.
Great starter recipe. Came out done and fluffy. I added several veggies and made a heartier meal,
No changes, would definitely make again
I just used Pam spray for the dish. Added spinach, bell peppers and a little bacon. It increased the baking time by about 5 minutes. The sour cream really makes it fluffy
Easy, fluffy and moist. My new favorite

Added a bit of red onion and red pepper flakes and ground italian sausage and tex
Mex instead of just cheddar ??
Why is it mine never looks as good as the picture? Also, are there tomatoes or red peppers in the original recipe? See something red in the picture.
So far so good
Love this recipie..easy, presents very well, and family can’t get enough

I substituted plain nonfat yogurt and lemon juice for the sour cream. I think I may have cooked this dish a bit longer than the recipe called for. Maybe 20 minutes longer, as I recall. It definitely turned out amazing, and went very nicely with a hearty crusty bread and fruit for breakfast with company. And, it made excellent leftovers!
This one is easy but isn't super exciting. It's OK.
This was really tasty. I had to bake it for 50 minutes though. I added cooked, crumbled sausage to mine and also added more cheese into the egg mixture.
Easy and delicious recipe as is, but this time I added tomatoes, bacon, spinach and chives.
Great recipe! I usually add some more veggies (tomatoes, broccoli, etc) to it and it’s always a big hit with the family.
A good and simple way to make eggs.

Very light. We added some cilantro to it & when baking it smelled sooooo good. We didn't have any ham, bacon or sausage out of the freezer so just did as listed plus the cilantro. Hubby didn't measure out the cheddar cheese either because we love our cheeses. Will make again & easy to warm up leftovers in microwave without it getting soggy or anything.
Substituted full fat yogurt for sour cream gave it a richer flavor but increased cooking time to 40 minutes
We made this with some diced leftover breakfast sausages, diced asparagus and garlic, gruyere and Asiago cheeses. Really excellent!
THis dish turned out very light and fluffy. I omitted the green onions, added bacon bits and mushrooms. Way better than trying to make an omelet in a pan on the stove.
